decision_conditions: <p><span id="docs-internal-guid-2607829b-7fff-5baa-9224-7081d23572fe"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.295;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">The proposed development, by reason of its size, design and position, would result in loss of light and outlook, overbearing impact, increased sense of enclosure, and increased overlooking and noise, which would result in an unacceptable adverse impact on the amenity of the neighbouring occupiers. As such the proposed development is contrary to policies D3 (Optimising Site Capacity through the Design-led Approach) D6 (Housing Quality and Standards) of the London Plan 2021, policy LP2 (Development and Amenity) of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 and the guidance contained within Hackney Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2009.</span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size: 14px; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">ï»¿The proposed development, by reason of its bulk, scale, massing and position would result in an obtrusive and incompatible form of development which would fail to respect the character and appearance of the subject property and the appearance of the Graham Road and Mapledene Conservation Area. As such, the proposed development is contrary to Policies D3 (Optimising Site Capacity through the Design-led Approach) and HC1 (Heritage Conservation and Growth) of the London Plan 2021, LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character), LP3 (Designated Heritage Assets) and LP17 (Housing Design) of the Hackney Local Plan 2033, and the guidance contained within Hackney Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2009.</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-2c83e4fc-7fff-a9cc-86d4-b8a774b5b309"><br><br></span></p>
